title: Player One
text:
ABOUT ME


The Origin Story
My journey into the digital realm began at a young age, where I discovered the magic of video games. What started as button-mashing on my first console quickly evolved into a deep fascination with the technology behind the screens. I wasnâ€™t just playing gamesâ€”I was wondering how they were made, how the graphics rendered so smoothly, and how online multiplayer could connect players from across the world.
This curiosity sparked a passion for technology that would shape my entire future. After completing secondary school, I knew exactly where I wanted to goâ€”Nanyang Polytechnic, where I pursued a diploma in Infocomm Technology. Those three years were transformative, diving deep into programming, networking, and software development. It was there that I truly leveled up my technical skills and confirmed that tech was my calling.
But the quest didnâ€™t end there. Hungry for more knowledge and driven to specialize, I enrolled at the Singapore Institute of Technology to pursue a degree in Fintech. Now Iâ€™m combining my love for technology with the exciting world of finance, learning about blockchain, digital payments, and the future of financial services. Itâ€™s like unlocking a new game modeâ€”challenging, rewarding, and full of possibilities.
When Iâ€™m not grinding through assignments or exploring new technologies, youâ€™ll still find me gaming. Some things never changeâ€”itâ€™s where I recharge, connect with friends, and remind myself why I fell in love with tech in the first place.

FAVOURITE CREATOR






Wiljum - Rust Content Creator
One of my favourite gaming content creators! Wiljum creates incredible Rust gameplay videos with cinematic storytelling. His videos showcase epic raids, intense PvP battles, and hilarious moments that keep me entertained for hours. If youâ€™re into survival games, his content is a must-watch.

Profile Photo

title: FYP Project
text:
PROJECT OVERVIEW

FinYouth - Social Finance App for the Youth
For my Final Year Project at Nanyang Polytechnic, I developed FinYouth, an innovative social application designed to bridge the gap between young adults and financial literacy. The app combines social networking features with insurance and financial planning tools, making personal finance more accessible and engaging for the youth demographic.

title: FYP Project
text:
THE PROBLEM

Financial literacy among young adults in Singapore remains a significant challenge. Many youths find traditional insurance and financial planning intimidating, confusing, or simply boring. They often delay important financial decisions until itâ€™s too late, missing out on the benefits of early financial planning.
Research shows that young adults are more likely to engage with content through social platforms. This insight became the foundation for FinYouthâ€”why not meet them where they already are?

title: FYP Project
text:
THE SOLUTION


Social Integration
Connect with friends to share financial goals, celebrate milestones, and learn from each otherâ€™s journeys. Financial planning becomes a community experience rather than a solo struggle.


Insurance Made Simple
Break down complex insurance products into bite-sized, easy-to-understand modules. Interactive calculators help users determine their coverage needs without the jargon.


Gamified Savings
Set savings goals, track progress, and earn achievements. Friendly competition with friends motivates consistent saving habits.


Financial Education
Curated content including articles, videos, and quizzes tailored for young adults. Learn about CPF, investments, budgeting, and more in an engaging format.

title: FYP Project
text:
TECH STACK


Frontend
React Native


Backend
Node.js / Express


Database
MongoDB


Cloud
AWS

title: FYP Project
text:
KEY LEARNINGS

This project taught me invaluable lessons beyond just coding. I learned to conduct user research, iterate based on feedback, and balance technical feasibility with user needs. Working on a full-stack application from concept to deployment gave me a holistic understanding of the software development lifecycle.
Most importantly, I discovered my passion for creating technology that makes a real difference in peopleâ€™s lives. FinYouth wasnâ€™t just a graduation requirementâ€”it was a glimpse into the kind of meaningful work I want to pursue in my career.
